issues.title: Users are unable to create / modify events on the shared calendar
issues.body:
Issue:
- User A creates a calendar and shares it with User B
- User B can see the shared calender, but cann't create or modify events
- Additionally some of the shared calenders aren't showed in "calender" section, but in "subscription"

![2017-12-18 10_22_17-spiceworks - tickets ri offen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34334575/34098803-dff6a7ae-e3dd-11e7-8fad-ed3b5c3cdb93.png)

----------------

Initial Idea was an OC Upgrade vom 8.1 -> 10 AND Migration to 64bit System

Starting at:
- openSUSE 13.1 i586 (32bit)
- ownCloud 8.1.9
- Calendar 0.7.4

----------------

Did the following:
openSuSE 13.1 to 13.2 (32bit) regarding OC 10 dependencies
System is on
- Apache2: 2.4.10-31.1
- MySQL: 5.6.34-2.23.1
- PHP: 5.6.1-89.1

----------------

- Update ownCloud 8.1.x -> 8.2.x
- Update ownCloud 8.2.x -> 9.0.x
ran into this issue: #800
solved it like this:
go to lib/private/integritycheck/checker.php and just returning false in function isCodeCheckEnforced

----------------

ownCloud Update 9.0 -> 9.1 ... using:
sudo -u wwwrun php occ dav:migrate-calenders
sudo -u wwwrun php occ dav:migrate-addressbooks
ran into the same error -> see "calender issue" above ... fixed it the same way

next error - if I try to activate the calender app - "App Folder already exists", so I did:
rename Foldername to Foldername.old (in app Subdirectory)
Installed the App from Webgui again

----------------

ownCloud Update 9.1 -> 10.x ... next error during "sudo -u wwwrun php occ upgrade"
Repair warning: Please install or update the following apps manually or disable them with ... did it:
occ app:disable activity
occ app:disable calendar
occ app:disable filespdfviewer_
occ app:disable filestexteditor_
occ app:disable gallery

updated all apps using webgui

----------------

next step should be the migration from 32bit to 64bit system...
...but at first I've to fix the calender issue!

Calender worked till "9.1 -> 10.x"

----------------

initially this issue was diskussed at https://github.com/owncloud/calendar/issues/830#issuecomment-352350491 which was opened by SimoneCampinoti ... for clearing up the situation (Simone was talking about "non-proprietary users") DeepDiver1975 decided to separate it and forced me to open a new case...

Best,
Mike

issues.title: Can't add a CalDAV subscription that is user restricted
issues.body:
I tried to add a CalDAV Subscription with a URL like this :

**https://my.url:8080/calendar/caldav/myuser**

This CalDAV Account is restricted for "myuser".
I tried to add the credentials to the URL like:

**https://myuser@my.url:8080/calendar/caldav/myuser**

and 

**https://myuser:mypassword@my.url:8080/calendar/caldav/myuser**


But none of them worked.
I get a 401 Notification.

How can I add a restricted CalDAV Account to my subscriptions?

issues.title: 99/5000 non-proprietary users are unable to create / modify events on the shared calendar
issues.body:
<!--
owncloud 10.0.3
 Calendar 1.5.4
-->
### Steps to reproduce
1. with user A create a calendar 
2. share the calendar to LDAP user B 
3.User A can see 2 time the shared calendar line to User B (the first one with write permission and se second without; in the table oc_dav_shares we can find 2 record one with access = 2 and resourceid = display name the other with access=3 and resource id = user id)
4) User B cannot delete add or modify events




see also 
https://github.com/nextcloud/server/issues/4885

issues.title: Sharing of calendar doesn't work with owncloud 10.0.3.3 and calendar app 1.5.4
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. owncloud is set up from 9.x via 9.1.5.2 to 10.0.0 to 10.0.3.3 (it worked already but now sharing has disappeared)
2. opening calendar of any user and click on "sharing"-icon
3. enter name of any other user and/or pick one from the list of existing users

### Expected behaviour
The checkmark-fields (those to allow modify and share) should appear after selecting one of the valid usernames from the list. 
I looked after the changes written in this commit:
https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/dcb92b84cf53d10b2d4be3109fad1a002be18225
All changes in those four files shown there are implemented (as part of 10.0.3.3 an calendar 1.5.4, I guess).

no reaction after selecting a valid username, no access to the shared calendar for the other user.

issues.title: Sharing with write permission not possible when target user has a different display name
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a user "jon.doe" with display name "Jon Doe"
2. Try to share a calendar with Jon Doe and allow to edit the calendar
3. Reload calendar page

### Expected behaviour
Calendar should be shared one time with Jon Doe and he may edit the events.

### Actual behaviour
Calendar seems to be shared two times, one time with and one time without write permission. Jon Doe is not able to edit the events.

issues.title: Undefined month in catalan language
issues.body:
In version 1.5.4 instead of "Octubre 2017" there is an "Undefined 2017". In earlier version, v1.4.1, worked fine.
The calendar and the appointments are correct. The error is just that I have to count how many times I go forth or back to know which month is displayed.
I have tried other languages (spanish, english and français) and there is no error.

I'm using OC9.1.6.

The logs sais that "/apps/calendar/js/vendor/autosize/dist/autosize.js" is missing.

issues.title: Problem with catalan translation
issues.body:
OwnCloud 10.0.2 (stable) 
Calendar version 1.5.4

The file /apps/calendar/js/public/vendor.min.js has the catalan translation in what I suppose it's the old format. The month names for example are displayed as "Undefined" instead of the proper way.

I would send a patch against the file in the git repo but it's simply not there. I can't find any vendor.min.js file in the calendar git or even in the core project. Anyway, attached is the corrected vendor.min.js file and at least it works for me (I just changed the catalan translation to match the new format).

[vendor.min.js.zip](https://github.com/owncloud/calendar/files/1313434/vendor.min.js.zip)

issues.title: The event title is "busy" even if you can edit it
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create an event in the calendar, go to the event's details and select "When shared, show busy only"  
2. Share the calendar to another person and allow the person to edit
3. Person who can edit sees the event title as busy.

### Expected behaviour
Tell us what should happen
- Person who can edit should see what he/she's editing, so the title shouldn't be "busy", but the real one.

### Actual behaviour
Tell us what happens instead
-Person who can edit sees the event title - "busy".
-Person still can overwrite the title even if he/she doesn't know what the real title is.

### Server configuration
**Operating system**: CentOs 7-3-1611

**Web server:** apache

**Database:** Mysql, MariaDb

**PHP version:** 5.6

**ownCloud version:** (see your admin page) 10.0.2

**Calendar version:** (see the apps page) 1.4.2

**Updated from an older installed version or fresh install:** fresh

If there is a quick fix for it i would kindly ask you to tell me, because i would like to start using your app asap, but this thing doesn't let me.

issues.title: Problems with events with RRULE:BYYEARDAY in oC 10
issues.body:
<!--
Please report only issues corresponding to the calendar for ownCloud / Nextcloud 9 or later.
The old calendar, which is compatible with ownCloud 8.2 or earlier, is discontinued!

Migration and CalDAV issues belong in the core repo!
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues
-->
### Steps to reproduce
1. Try to import the following ics into oC 10, OR
2. Import into oC 9 and upgrade to oC 10

BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
PRODID:-//SabreDAV//SabreDAV//EN
BEGIN:VEVENT
LAST-MODIFIED;VALUE=DATE-TIME:20130919T114408Z
SEQUENCE:0
STATUS:CONFIRMED
TRANSP:OPAQUE
SUMMARY:Failed Event
CREATED:20110925T174221Z
RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY;BYYEARDAY=118;INTERVAL=1
DTSTAMP;VALUE=DATE-TIME:20130919T114408Z
UID:libkcal-1325022979.73
CLASS:PUBLIC
DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:19700428
DTEND;VALUE=DATE:19700429
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR

### Expected behaviour
byyearday.ics should import into oc 10, or oc 9, and display.

### Actual behaviour
Import into oc 10 hangs at "Import scheduled".

This came from a calendar I had in oC 9. When I upgraded and opened the calendar app, two calendars never rendered and just showed the spinning loading graphic. I was able to export one calendar and find the failing entries, all of which were using BYYEARDAY. Changing them all to RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY allowed them to be imported into a new calendar that worked as expected.

(Not sure why they were created with BYYEARDAY in the first place, it wasn't really required, but they were.)

### Server configuration
**Operating system**: FreeBSD 10

**Web server:** Apache 2.4

**Database:** SQLLite

**PHP version:** 5.6.30

**Server version:** (see your admin page) 10.0.1.5

**Calendar version:** (see the apps page) 1.4.2

issues.title: If in multiple groups with different permissions (read, write) read has higher priority than write
issues.body:
<!--
Please report only issues corresponding to the calendar for ownCloud / Nextcloud 9 or later.
The old calendar, which is compatible with ownCloud 8.2 or earlier, is discontinued!

Migration and CalDAV issues belong in the core repo!
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues
-->
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have a group A with read permission on a calendar
2. Have a group B with write permission on the same calendar

### Expected behaviour
The users of the group should be allowed to write to the calendar as group B would

### Actual behaviour
The user is only allowed to read the calendar as group A would. The calendar is shown
as "Abonnement" (german) and not as own calendar.

### Server configuration
**Operating system**: 
Debian jessie

**Web server:**
Apache

**Database:**
MySQL

**PHP version:**
5.6.30

**Server version:** (see your admin page)
9.1.5

**Calendar version:** (see the apps page)
1.4.1

**Updated from an older installed version or fresh install:**
updated

issues.title: event from iPhone won't be synced to ownCloud Calendar
issues.body:
ownCloud 9.1.4 with Calendar


### Steps to reproduce
1. Add a Calendar to ownCloud
2. Give somebody write access to this Calendar
3. This person (with write access) syncs the Calendar to the iPhone.
4. This person wants to add an event to the Calendar via iPhone.
5. Data won't be synced to the ownCloud.
6. This person has got only write access via Web GUI.

### Expected behaviour
The person with write access can sync his data from his iPhone to the Calendar on ownCloud.

### Actual behaviour
Data won't be synced to ownCloud. The person hasn't got write access to the shared calendar via iPhone.

### Server configuration
**Operating system**: Ubuntu 16.04

**Web server:**

**Database:** MySQL

**PHP version:**

**Server version:** 9.1.4

**Calendar version:** latest

**Updated from an older installed version or fresh install:** updated

**Signing status (ownCloud/Nextcloud 9.0 and above):**



**List of activated apps:** Calendar (most important app)

issues.title: Improve logging of the calendar app
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set Loglevel to debug

### Expected behaviour
I've expected that all events are logged. Instead it is not logged if a new appointment is created or deleted (I've got reports from users who are complaining about deleted appointments - I wanted to find out what is happening).

issues.title: Contact birthdays are not shown
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the Calendar-App-Icon
2. The app opens
### Expected behaviour

I'm expecting that my contact birthdays are shown. But instead there is a spinning wheel in front of the contact birthday calendar and the birthdays are not shown.
I already tried a `sudo -u www-data ./occ dav:sync-birthday-calendar` but it didn't solve my issue.
### Actual behaviour

Contact birthdays are not shown. Spinning wheel in front of contact birthday calendar.

issues.title: Unable to create new event on Android phones
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Open Calendar on Android phone
2.  On Month, Week or Day view, tap any open area.

### Expected behaviour
New event editor modal should open.

### Actual behaviour
Nothing.

Event editor opens correctly when an existing event is tapped, but there appears to be no way to create a new event on an Android phone (tested on LG G3 and Moto X Pure)

### Server configuration
**Operating system**:
RedHat

**Web server:**
apache

**Database:**
mysql5

**PHP version:**
5.4.45

**Server version:** (see your admin page)
9.1.4 (stable)

**Calendar version:** (see the apps page)
1.4.1

issues.title: oC 9.1. - Thunderbird  lightning 4.7.4 - bad notification and multiple event with local participant
issues.body:
Hi,
sorry for my poor english

### Steps to reproduce
I've the following configuration:
owncloud's server has a configuration to send mail, and possed this mail: ocserver@company.com

Users, mail.
toto, toto@company.com
titi, titi@company.com
tata, tata@company.com

each user share his calendar with others, and has the 3 webdav calendar's in his thunderbird.

1- toto create event with titi and tata like participants
2- titi and tata receive mail with invitation
3- titi accept invitation and add event in his webdav calendar
4- toto receive mail with acceptation from titi and update his event in his webdav calendar
5- tata accept invitation and add event in his webdav calendar
6- toto receive mail with acceptation from tata and update his event in his webdav calendar

### Expected behaviour
Before 9.1's owncloud version:

+ after step 1, only one event was created on toto's calendar, with two participant's not confirmed.
+ at step 2, titi and tata receive mail from toto@company.com
+ after step 6, each user has in his calendar one event with two participant's confirmed

### Actual behaviour
+ after step 1, one event his created on each calendar, with two participant's confirmed
+ at step2, titi and tata receive mail from ocserver@company.com
+ after step 6, 
toto has one event with tata and titi confirmed
titi has one event with tata and titi confirmed and one event with tata an titi not confirmed
tata has one event with tata and titi confirmed and one event with  titi confirmed and tata not confirmed

issues.title: Missing starting event on weird recurrences
issues.body:
To whomever it may concern:

While testing an ics-parser with all kinds of recurrences I noticed that for certain cases of weird recurrences the calendar-application will ommit the setted starting event:

=====================================

BEGIN:VEVENT
CREATED:20161229T202620Z
LAST-MODIFIED:20161229T202648Z
DTSTAMP:20161229T202648Z
UID:d3b9fe8a-3674-46aa-ad1a-008f913d0fdb
SUMMARY:Wiederholungen 7
RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;COUNT=7;BYDAY=MO,TH,FR,SA
DTSTART;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20161207T220000
DTEND;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20161207T230000
TRANSP:OPAQUE
END:VEVENT

=====================================

BEGIN:VEVENT
CREATED:20161229T202620Z
LAST-MODIFIED:20161229T215411Z
DTSTAMP:20161229T215411Z
UID:d3b9fe8a-3674-46aa-ad1a-008f913d0fdb
SUMMARY:Wiederholungen 7
STATUS:CONFIRMED
RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;COUNT=7;BYDAY=MO,TU,WE,TH,FR
DTSTART;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20161210T220000
X-MOZ-GENERATION:3
TRANSP:OPAQUE
DURATION:PT1H
SEQUENCE:4
END:VEVENT

=====================================

Recurrences on a daily basis (same result as the one before) will be handled correctly:

BEGIN:VEVENT
CREATED:20161229T202620Z
LAST-MODIFIED:20161229T220336Z
DTSTAMP:20161229T220336Z
UID:d3b9fe8a-3674-46aa-ad1a-008f913d0fdb
SUMMARY:Wiederholungen 7
STATUS:CONFIRMED
RRULE:FREQ=DAILY;COUNT=7;BYDAY=MO,TU,WE,TH,FR
DTSTART;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20161210T220000
X-MOZ-GENERATION:3
TRANSP:OPAQUE
DURATION:PT1H
SEQUENCE:4
END:VEVENT

It would be nice to have this fixed in the future.
I haven't checked the behaviour for monthly recurrences yet.


Best regards,
Simon

issues.title: add multi-day per-week repetition
issues.body:
Currently, Calendar only supports having quite simple repetitions. You can repeat an event every X days, weeks, months or years. However, you can't do what Google Calendar does, which is to repeat an event on certain days every X weeks (for example, every second monday and tuesday). You can have events that occur every second week, but not every second week **on multiple days**.

This is quite important for meetings and other such things. I'd just take a page out of Google Calender's book on how the UX should look.

issues.title: breaks sync
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Fresh install of nextcloud 10.0 + calendar 1.4.0
2. Export all *.ics from owncloud 8.2.4 / calendar 0.8.2 using web-frontend
3. re-import all *.ics using web-frontend
4. looks perfect at web-frontend

### Expected behaviour
should sync calendars with client

### Actual behaviour
one calendar is breaking the sync process
removing it cures the problem
no issue with earlier version

### Server configuration
linux

**Web server:**
shared hosting

**Database:**
sqlite

**PHP version:**
7

issues.title: "Import Scheduled" shown when importing to a new calendar and a calendar with the same name is already existing or there is no calendar name given in the ICS
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce 1
1. Get an ICS file of a calendar (including a calendar name)
2. Import that into OC Calendar and choose to create a new calendar
3. Import that file into OC Calendar again and choose to create a new calendar, again.

### Expected behaviour 1
Either, a new calendar (basically a copy of the previously created one) should be created with some unique name, different to the one mentioned in the ICS, or a meaningful error message should be shown like "A calendar with the name [xxx] already exists. Cannot create a new calendar with the same name".

### Actual behaviour 1
"Import Scheduled" is shown and user cannot do anything than reload the page in order this message to be closed.

### Steps to reproduce 2
1. Get an ICS file of a calendar (WITHOUT a calendar name)
2. Import that into OC Calendar and choose to create a new calendar

### Expected behaviour 2
Either, a new calendar should be created with some unique name, or a meaningful error message should be shown like "No Calendar name in the ICS. Cannot create a calendar without a name".

### Actual behaviour 2
"Import Scheduled" is shown and user cannot do anything than reload the page in order this message to be closed.

Please note that this is not an urgent issue, but it took me quite some time to find out why this "Import Scheduled" message was shown.

issues.title: Feature request: extend night time hours for music industry
issues.body:
An issue that many DJs, artist, booking agencies, venues encounter when syncing agendas with online calendars is that, for a DJ/Artist a gig on Saturday from 01:00 - 03:00 is in fact Sunday morning in calendar lingo.

When you have multiple gigs in one night, our customized agenda would show (example):

Saturday _(some date)_
21:00 - 23:00 first gig
01:00 - 03:00 second gig

In calendars above example would show as:

Saturday _(some date)_
01:00 - 03:00 second gig
21:00 - 23:00 first gig

or

Saturday _(some date)_
21:00 - 23:00 first gig

Sunday _(next date)_
01:00 - 03:00 second gig

Both are undesired. Same with nightclub itineraries. A club that is open from 22:00 - 05:00 needs to be able to list their artists' playing times in sequential order. 

For our custom built agenda software we use extended hours. Sunday 02:00 is stored as Saturday 26:00 - that way they're shown on the "correct" date and sorted in the actual order. We manage this by setting a custom "start of new day" moment: we have set this at 07:00, so 06:59 is stored as _(previous date)_ 30:59, 07:00 is stored as _(actual date)_ 07:00.

Front-end display anticipates this (if time > 2400 time = (time - 2400)) - after sorting the times.

I would really like to be able to use the power of Owncloud Calendar to be able to manage our gigs and share it with collaborators. When a driver wants to flag a date as "unavailable" it will raise an alert we need to find a replacement driver if on that day there is a gig at 26:00.

Currently if I enter 26:00 as time in Owncloud Calendar, it changes to 02:00 alright, but it is moved to the next day. I would like it to stay on the day it is entered - displayed as 02:00 and sorted after 21:00 instead of before.

issues.title: Deleting the whole Calendar
issues.body:
The actual implementation of the Calendar app has only a "can edit" option.

By this the shared calendar can be completly deleted by users who have this permission.

It is a very common use case to share a calendar where many (100+) users should be allowed to add, edit or delete calendar items, but should not be able to delete the calendar as a whole.

The actual configuration is not suitable for this very common use case. It will simply happen from a certain number of users that the calendar will be deleted accidentaly. The permission to delete a calendar should therefore be seperated from "can edit".

issues.title: Move some caldav calls into Calendar Model
issues.body:
Whats about moving some of the caldav calls into the `Calendar` model itself.
The `CalendarService` would keep `get`, `getAll` and `create`.
but:
`calendar.update()` instead of `CalendarService.update(calendar)`
`calendar.delete()` instead of `CalendarService.delete(calendar)`
`calendar.share(...)` instead of `CalendarService.share(calendar, ...)`
`calendar.unshare(...)` instead of `CalendarService.unshare(calendar, ...)`

issues.title: rename CalController to AppController
Moving single Event from recurring Events results in duplicated Event
issues.body:
<!--
Thanks for reporting issues back to ownCloud! This is the issue tracker of ownCloud, if you have any support question please check out https://owncloud.org/support

This is the bug tracker for the Server component. Find other components at https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#guidelines

For reporting potential security issues please see https://owncloud.org/security/

To make it possible for us to help you please fill out below information carefully.
--> 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create Calendar in Owncloud an connect this by CalDAV to Thunderbird/Lightning (but can also be reproduced on Android using DAVdroid)
2. Create an Recurring Event in Lightning (e.g. recurring every second day)
3. Sync to Owncloud -> everything is fine
4. Move one of the Events one Day forward (e.g by drag and drop)
5. Sync to Owncloud -> A new Event is created but the old stayed in the Owncloud Calendar
### Expected behaviour

The moved Event should be moved to the new Place
### Actual behaviour

A new Event in created (it's ok so far), but the old one is not getting deleted. The old one also seems to get touched by CalDAV because ist recurrance Settings are removed. Lightning Calendar also shows properly so Owncloud and Lightning are out of sync right now.
### Server configuration

**Operating system**:
Raspbian Jessie / Kernel 4.4.9
**Web server:**
Apache 2.4.10
**Database:**
MySQL 5.5.44
**PHP version:**
PHP 5.6.20
**ownCloud version:** (see ownCloud admin page)
ownCloud 9.0.2 (stable)
**Updated from an older ownCloud or fresh install:**
fresh install
**Where did you install ownCloud from:**
download.owncloud.org

Calendar,
Addressbook

**Are you using external storage, if yes which one:** local/smb/sftp/...
no

no

no

Firefox 46

Win10

Not a priority at all at the moment.
What would be a use case anyway?

The biggest priority is currently getting the calendar rework ready for ownCloud 9. Some features like creating and editing events are not fully reimplemented yet and that's definitely more important than searching events ;).

If we come up with more and more features and always postpone the initial release, we'll never release this. We have to set milestones and assign priorities to be able to release something anytime soon. Anyhow this is not set in stone. If there is plenty of time left between us finishing the rework (this doesn't only include coding but also lots of heavy testing, which is really important here) and ownCloud 9 being released, we might implement this for ownCloud 9. The same goes if someone sends a really good pull request.
You are already able to set alarms in the events editor of rework.
:tada::tada::tada:

There is one remaining issue I would like to resolve:

ICS files can contain events, todos and journals. Calendars are allowed to not support all three types.
(e.g. a calendar could only store events, but no todos or journals)
So the question is what to do:
- If e.g. a user tries to import an ics with events and todos:
  - 1. only show calendars that support at least events and todos (if none, there is still the new calendar option)
  - 2. show all calendars but add a warning that not all objects from the ics will be imported

theoretically yes, but that means implementing some parsing logic for todos and journals, which will be quite some work.

another issue is how to notify the user about events (or todos or journals) rejected by the server.

> do you have concrete plans already how the migration story for people moving from owncloud 8.2 to 9.0 looks like?

I agree that it should ideally be done fully automatic. AFAIK the calendar table is pretty much the same, but the objects table is a bit different. It now contains firstoccurrence and lastoccurrence, so we have to parse every single object :/

So maybe some extra upgrade routine after the actual update to ownCloud 9.

issues.title: The supplied iCalendar datetime value is incorrect
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Download ics file: 
   [Democracy_and_Governance.ics.txt](https://github.com/owncloud/calendar/files/451609/Democracy_and_Governance.ics.txt)

More example calendars can be found here:
https://campus.uni-due.de/lsf/rds?state=wtree&search=1&trex=step&root120162=168171|162259|169922|163589|165282|166180&P.vx=kurz
1. Remove the txt postfix
2. Import it to an existing calendar of your OC/NC
### Expected behaviour

Import without any issues as Thunderbird Lightning 47.0 does it and display the appointments correctly.
### Actual behaviour

A warning (!)  occurs beside the upload button which says:
"The file contains objects which are not compatible."

The calendar is not shown. Appointments of another calendar were put to Tuesday instead of Monday.  
The log states: `The supplied iCalendar datetime value is incorrect`
### Question

Why is the error message only found in the internal OC server log and not shown to the user at the front end?
### Further notes

Uploading and importing works with other calendars, eg. with those I created on Nextcloud,  downloaded and reimported to a new calendar.                                                                                       
### Server configuration

**Operating system**: Debian 8

**Web server:** NginX

**Database:** MySQL 

**PHP version:** 5.6.24

**Server version:** NC 10

**Calendar version:** 1.3.3

**Updated from an older installed version or fresh install:** Update

**Signing status (ownCloud/Nextcloud 9.0 and above):** Signed
### File integrity check

All good.
### Config.php (censored)

`<?php
$CONFIG = array (
  'instanceid' => '',
  'passwordsalt' => '',
  'secret' => '',
  'trusted_domains' => 
  array (
    0 => '',
    1 => '',
  ),
  'filelocking.enabled' => 'true',
  'memcache.local' => '\\OC\\Memcache\\Redis',
  'memcache.distributed' => '\\OC\\Memcache\\Redis',
  'memcache.locking' => '\\OC\\Memcache\\Redis',
  'redis' => 
  array (
    'host' => 'localhost',
    'port' => 6379,
    'timeout' => 0,
  ),
  'cache_path' => '',
  'datadirectory' => '',
  'overwrite.cli.url' => '',
  'dbtype' => 'mysql',
  'version' => '9.1.0.16',
  'dbname' => '',
  'dbhost' => 'localhost',
  'dbtableprefix' => '',
  'dbuser' => '',
  'dbpassword' => '',
  'installed' => true,
  'forcessl' => true,
  'forceSSLforSubdomains' => true,
  'loglevel' => 0,
  'theme' => '',
  'maintenance' => false,
  'trashbin_retention_obligation' => 'auto',
  'appstore.experimental.enabled' => false,
  'htaccess.RewriteBase' => '/nextcloud',
  'updater.release.channel' => 'stable',
);
`
### Client configuration

issues.title: Events as tasks and vice versa
issues.body:
Hello,

Two (not that) small proposals for killing features. I think it involves also the Tasks app but as it seems to me that it requires more work from the Calendar app, I create the ticket here.
### 1. Events as tasks

I think having the possibility to mark an event as a task would be very useful. The main use case I see is the following:
1. the user inserts events on some calendars, and marks some as "tasks" (e.g. "buy more coffee").
2. those calendars are _de facto_ a list in the Tasks app and offer a view of the event that are "tasks".
3. the tasks can then automatically appeared in "**Today**", "**This week**" and "**Important**".

Finishing a task would cross the event in the calendar.

Optionally, the possibility to switch the view to displayed the tasks either by "planned date" or "ending date" would be nice. A small "star" to display the task labelled as important and a small bar to notify the progression would be a plus.
### 2. Tasks displayed on calendar

The rational is that we often have a huge list of tasks that we would like to do, without having the time or the possibility to perfectly define when we will start them. If I plan my week in the Calendar app,  I would like to take the tasks I already defined in the Tasks app to turn it into an event that would appear on the Calendar view.

The Task app already allow us to define progression, starting date and due date so I think this is just about a bridge between the apps.

By the way, thank you for you work on this cool app. It is very appreciated. :)

issues.title: Full free/busy support
issues.body:
As a meeting organiser I want to be able to see if the meeting participants are available when I'm defining the time slot.

issues.title: OC9.0.4 - calendar 1.3.1.0 - not all occurencies of repeated events are shown
issues.body:
## Expected behavior

All occurrences of repeating events should be shown when using the calendar app.
## Current behavior

Some of the occurrences of repeating events are not shown in the calendar app, although they are correctly shown in Thunderbird-Lightning, on an Android phone or on an iPhone.

In my specific case I was able to pin-down the effect to the following calendar entry, which is not shown on July 25th 2016:

```
BEGIN:VEVENT
CREATED:20151212T175930Z
LAST-MODIFIED:20160724T100002Z
DTSTAMP:20160724T100002Z
UID:2a967df4-347a-4ec7-861d-48b25116bd4c
SUMMARY:Papier (blau)
RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;UNTIL=20161212;INTERVAL=4;BYDAY=MO
X-MOZ-LASTACK:20160724T100002Z
DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20160307
DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20160308
TRANSP:TRANSPARENT
LOCATION:NE
```

issues.title: Option to filter out alarms of shared calendars
issues.body:
I would appreciate an option to filter out reminders of shared calendars. 

Example: Every user has multiple calendars (work, private, etc.). User A has read-only access to user B's calendars, in order to schedule shared events if needed. However, user A does not want to be reminded of every event of user B (e.g. through Thunderbird or Android Calendar).  

Solution: Add a checkbox to shared calendars, which when selected filter out reminders of the shared calendar for this user.

issues.title: Changing Start-Time of recurring events with exlusions corrupt exclusions
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a recurring event with start and end time.
2. Delete one instance of that event series (e.g. via CalDAV-Client - as the WebUI does not allow this)
3. Change start-time
### Expected behaviour

All instances should change their start-time and excluded / deleted instances should stay excluded / deleted
### Actual behaviour

The excluded / deleted instances re-occur. What really happens is that the 
EXDATE entries don't change their start-time accordingly but new EXDATE entries are created.
See my example:

EXDATE;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20160822T190000
EXDATE;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20160822T193000
EXDATE;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20160829T190000
EXDATE;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20160829T193000

Instead of 

EXDATE;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20160822T193000
EXDATE;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20160829T193000

issues.title: Special characters break calendar
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a new event and paste a special character into the location field (in my case, an end of text character [0x03] ended up in there)
2. Try to view calendar
### Expected behaviour

The event should be shown with the special character stripped (or it should be stripped before it is inserted into the database).
### Actual behaviour

Depends on the client:
- Chrome shows an error about INVALID_EVENT and does not show any events in the week containing the problematic event (the spinner for the calendar containing the problematic event keeps spinning).
- Firefox simply does not show the problematic event (but all other events).
- DAVdroid correctly syncs the event (and apparently strips the special character).
- GNOME does not sync the problematic event (but all other events).

Deleting the problematic event (using DAVdroid) makes everything work again.
### Server configuration

**Operating system**: Ubuntu 16.04
**Web server:** Apache 2.4.20
**Database:** PostgreSQL 9.5
**PHP version:** 7.0.8
**ownCloud version:** 9.0.3
**Calendar version:** 1.2
**Updated from an older ownCloud or fresh install:** updated
**Signing status (ownCloud 9.0 and above):** No errors have been found.
**List of activated apps:** Not relevant
**The content of config/config.php:** Not relevant
**Are you using external storage, if yes which one:** no
**Are you using encryption:** no
**Are you using an external user-backend, if yes which one:** no
### Client configuration

**Browser:** Chrome 51 and Firefox 47
**Operating system:** Fedora 24
**CalDAV-clients:** DAVdroid 1.2 and GNOME 3.20
### Logs
#### Web server error log

No errors
#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)

No errors
#### Browser log

See above

issues.title: Calendar missing from user after upgrade but still visible to those it was shared to
issues.body:
<!--
Please report only issues corresponding to the calendar for ownCloud 9 or later.
The old calendar, which is compatible with ownCloud 8.2 or earlier, is discontinued!

Migration and CalDAV issues belong in the core repo!
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues
-->
### Steps to reproduce

Have not tried to reproduce (don't have a spare server) but what I did was
1. Had a working OwnCloud 8 installation with calendar app installed
2. Had 2 users: A and B with 1 calendar each
3. Shared these calendars between the users (i.e. A->B, B->A) as read-only
4. Upgrade to OwnCloud 9.0.0
(Have since upgraded to 9.0.1 and problem remains unchanged.)
### Expected behaviour

Upon re-enabling new Calendar application, user A should see calendars A and B, and user B should also see Calendars A and B. Just as before.
### Actual behaviour
- User A sees calendars A and B (B's calendar is shown correctly as a subscription in A's account) 
- However, User B does not see any calendars (neither A's nor B's).

This is odd. I could understand if the calendar had been lost, but A sees B's shared calendar just fine. But to B it is as if they have never created any calendar, and they can't see A's either.

**Operating system**: FreeBSD 9.3

issues.title: Redundant time zone info displayed for Event
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. In Evolution calendar client, create a new event.
2. Check the event in OwnCloud Calendar app.
### Expected behaviour

The time zone info should be suppressed to something meaningfull: e.g. to show only Europe/Berlin or CEST.
### Actual behaviour

OwnCloud Calendar app shows: freeassociation.sourceforge.net - Europe - Berlin ()

Apart from displaying redundant info, the text is too long and clutters the display frame of the calendar event.

![oc calendar timezone text bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/937861/15016042/7bfe4104-120f-11e6-9b4c-b86d998b519d.png)

The ICS as exported from Evolution:

```
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
PRODID:-//Ximian//NONSGML Evolution Calendar//EN
VERSION:2.0
METHOD:PUBLISH
BEGIN:VTIMEZONE
TZID:/freeassociation.sourceforge.net/Europe/Berlin
X-LIC-LOCATION:Europe/Berlin
BEGIN:STANDARD
TZNAME:CET
DTSTART:19701030T030000
RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY;BYDAY=-1SU;BYMONTH=10
TZOFFSETFROM:+0200
TZOFFSETTO:+0100
END:STANDARD
BEGIN:DAYLIGHT
TZNAME:CEST
DTSTART:19700327T020000
RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY;BYDAY=-1SU;BYMONTH=3
TZOFFSETFROM:+0100
TZOFFSETTO:+0200
END:DAYLIGHT
END:VTIMEZONE
BEGIN:VEVENT
UID:20160504T133219Z-5766-1000-1-0@XXXX
DTSTAMP:20160504T132708Z
DTSTART;TZID=/freeassociation.sourceforge.net/Europe/Berlin:
 20160505T090000
DTEND;TZID=/freeassociation.sourceforge.net/Europe/Berlin:
 20160505T093000
SEQUENCE:2
SUMMARY:Test 09:00-09:30 CET DST
TRANSP:OPAQUE
CLASS:PUBLIC
CREATED:20160504T133254Z
LAST-MODIFIED:20160504T133254Z
X-EVOLUTION-CALDAV-HREF:
 20160504T133219Z-5766-1000-1-0_XXXX-20160504T133254Z.ics
X-EVOLUTION-CALDAV-ETAG:"dbfc0bff47bc40c23dae5249610375b7"
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR
```
### Other info

Other client on Android (CalDAV sync + aCalendar) works fine: it displays "Central European Summer Time (GMT+2)" and in detailed view it offers a few other countries within the same time zone (Czech Republic, Deutschland, Netherlands).

After changing time and description (and leaving time zone info untouched) on Android and syncing back to ownCloud, the Calendar App shows: "Amsterdam (Europe)". The ICS exported from the Calendar app shows that the time zone text was corrected by Android:

```
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
PRODID:-//Ximian//NONSGML Evolution Calendar//EN
VERSION:2.0
BEGIN:VTIMEZONE
TZID:Europe/Amsterdam
X-LIC-LOCATION:Europe/Amsterdam
BEGIN:DAYLIGHT
TZOFFSETFROM:+0100
TZOFFSETTO:+0200
TZNAME:CEST
DTSTART:19700329T020000
RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY;BYMONTH=3;BYDAY=-1SU
END:DAYLIGHT
BEGIN:STANDARD
TZOFFSETFROM:+0200
TZOFFSETTO:+0100
TZNAME:CET
DTSTART:19701025T030000
RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY;BYMONTH=10;BYDAY=-1SU
END:STANDARD
END:VTIMEZONE
BEGIN:VEVENT
CREATED:20160504T133254Z
DTSTART;TZID=Europe/Amsterdam:20160505T100000
SUMMARY:Test 09:00-09:30 CET DST chng to 10 on Android xx
TRANSP:OPAQUE
CLASS:PUBLIC
STATUS:CONFIRMED
DTEND;TZID=Europe/Amsterdam:20160505T103000
LAST-MODIFIED:20160504T140030Z
DTSTAMP:20160504T140030Z
SEQUENCE:5
UID:20160504T133219Z-5766-1000-1-0@XXXX
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR
```
### Server configuration

**PHP version:**
php 7.0.5-1
**ownCloud version:** (see ownCloud admin page)
owncloud 9.0.0-1
**Calendar version:** (see ownCloud apps page)
owncloud-app-calendar 1:1.0-1
**Updated from an older ownCloud or fresh install:**

**Operating system:**

issues.title: Improvement: parse time in event title prompt
issues.body:
Hello!

Great work on the new calendar, it's awesome. One time-saving feature I really like in Google calendar is the ability to set the time for an event on creation by typing it before the event title.
For example "14:00 Dentist" will be an event that starts at 14:00, with a default duration (for example 1 hour) with the title "Dentist".

What do you think?

issues.title: events can only be repeated "times" not until "date" anymore
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Add or edit an event.
2. Set "Repeat"
3. ...end repeat only shows "n-times", not "until date" anymore.
### Expected behaviour

"Repeat" should offer the option "until date" again.
### Actual behaviour

It's not there.
### Server configuration

**Operating system**:
Gentoo Linux

**Web server:**
Apache 2.4

**Database:**
Postgresql 9.3

**PHP version:**
5.6

**ownCloud version:** (see ownCloud admin page)
9.0.1

issues.title: Problem with Firefox and PunyCode/IDN domain names (with, e.g., ä/ö/ü)
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install OwnCloud 9.0.1 under an URL with non-ASCII characters (e.g., an IDN domain with German umlauts such as ä,ö,ü)
2. Use Mozilla Firefox 45.0.2
3. Create a calendar or activate existing calendar in the browser frontend
### Expected behaviour

Calendar should be created when pressing "create"
Existing calendar should be displayed (coloured dot left of the name should appear and events should be shown).
### Actual behaviour

Calendar creation fails, clicking on the "create" button does not give a reaction
Clicking on the name of an existing displays the spinner animated gif, but events do not appear
Using Chrome as browser, everything works as expected
### Server configuration

**Operating system**:
Linux
**Web server:**
Apache
**Database:**
MySQL
**PHP version:**
7
**ownCloud version:** (see ownCloud admin page)
9.0.1
**Calendar version:** (see ownCloud apps page)
1.1
**Updated from an older ownCloud or fresh install:**
Fresh install
### Reason

I've researched a bit and I think i can pin it down to js/vendor/davclient.js/lib/client.js: In line 364, a RegEx is used to match the URL. It is limited to ASCII characters. Obviously, the Chrome JavaScript engine replaces the URL with the PunyCode version, and Firefox does not. Thus, parsing the RegEx fails, the variable "parts" is null and the described behaviour occurs.

I am no JavaScript expert, but this may be a misbehaviour of Firefox JavaScript engine.

issues.title: Enhancement: add whole group as participants
issues.body:
Currently, if I create a new event on the web interface, I can add participants to this event either by their email address or by their owncloud user name (the latter is already a bit hidden, since the input line at least in German localization only mentions the email address). Since the app is obviously already able to contact information from an owncloud user, it would be nice if that would also work for user groups.

Suppose the following use case: let's say we have an owncloud instance that is used to provide some services for our sports club. To keep things organised we have put the members in various groups, like "active players" (the ones who are taking part in trainings and matches on a regular basis), "organizers" (people who have some organizational function), "dinosaurs" (those who do no longer play actively for age reasons but show up and want to stay in touch every now and then)... One of the features we use is a calendar to have an overview about how many people are available for training sessions and matches and other things like social events. If I now create a new event, it would be cool if I could just add the group of people which are concerned with this event as participants by their group name to get them noticed about it. So, for example, the active players' group for trainings, but also the dinosaurs for a monthly summer barbecue.

Right now, if I want to do so, I would have to enter all the participants one after the other by hand, which is obviously quite error-prone since it's easy to forget someone.

issues.title: Style past events differently
issues.body: To be able to quickly tell apart past events (and find today), we should give a slightly different style to them. For example a bit of transparency or grey them out a bit.

issue_comments.body:
List the icons you use from fontawesome and where/why you need them.

(Great initiative to question the dependencies!)
I’d say drop fontawesome as soon as possible.
Wow, that’s a lot of code for a few icons. Glad we’re getting rid of it. :+1:
Hope you’ll integrate with the core CalDAV soon. :)

As @georgehrke and @raghunayyar said before, this is too detailed. Here’s what we really need for a useful color picker:
- about 12 really nice colors
- using the same color palette as for the avatar placeholders: https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/core/js/placeholder.js#L58
- also defining a text color for each of those colors – for some black will be better, for some white will be needed
- for any new calendar which is created, pick the next color which hasn’t been used yet on another calendar by default

Would be really awesome if you’re up for implementing that. :)

Also, that color picker should not be hardcoded inside the Calendar but rather be made as its own library so other apps can also potentially use it. (Thinking about tags, groups, etc anything which might come in the future.)

@EtlamGit as I said above in https://github.com/owncloud/calendar-rework/pull/60#issuecomment-160068121 it’s very important for any color that we use to comply with the existing color palette we use in ownCloud. These colors are too primary, and too many. They do not fit into ownCloud. Please check out the placeholder library I referenced and see which colors it produces. :)
If we do use the sidebar, that should be our detail view. The main info like title, time and calendar should always be available superfast as a popover directly where you clicked.

The basic info should be shown and possible to edit directly in the popover – which solves the majority of cases. The sidebar should only be needed for advanced stuff, because it’s a more invasive element and a slight context switch.

Yeah, but only an icon which could then on click open the sidebar.

The event block itself in the calendar should also already have an alarm or attendee icon to signify that. Most other calendars do that too, next to the title.

I'd say it works fine, or at least good enough that we should show the actual interface instead of only instructions to set up Caldav.

Keep in mind mobile is not only very small smartphone screens but also tablets etc. If it doesn't work, switching to the Agenda view will do.
I don’t really get the issue. Just do it like we do it in the Calendar app at the moment. :) Or what changed?
Yep, I’d also say while we should also pay attention to mobile, desktop has to be the absolute focus here.
@georgehrke see the discussion in the core issue. I agree with @karlitschek that it's important to be as automatic as possible. However we need to gauge to which point this is possible.
I'd go for option 2 as it provides proper feedback.

Can we simply use that part of jQuery UI? Or is the whole lib always needed?

cc @owncloud/designers do you know of any modern good timepicker library which also work on mobile?

In the web client (oC) doesn't show creator info. When I add ownCloud calendar into Thunderbird+Lightning I'm able to see all details including creator.

2. create event (my own or other shared calendar)
3. go to event details

Not only settings but also creator should be displayed
### Actual behaviour

No info about creator

ownCloud 9.0.0 (stable)
### Client configuration

firefox: latest stable (45.0)
xubuntu/ubuntu: latest stable (LTS 14.04)

issues.title: When sharing a calendar, LDAP users show up as UUIDs
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Use LDAP for user authentication.
2. Go to the Calendar app in OwnCloud.
3. Click the button to share a calendar with other users
4. Begin typing a user name in the field.
5. Observe that instead of users names, UUIDs appear.

Internally, OwnCloud creates UUIDs for LDAP users that it uses as their username.  There is a separate display name that is used whenever the user's name should be displayed in the GUI.  It seems that LDAP users are being displayed as their UUID instead of display name.
### Expected behaviour

User's display names should be displayed in the auto-complete list when sharing a calendar.  
### Actual behaviour

User's internal UUIDs appear in the list.  After sharing a calendar with a user, their UUID appears in the list of peoples whom the calendar has been shared with.
### Server configuration

**Operating system**: Ubuntu Linux 14.04
**Web server:** Apache 2.4.7

issues.title: Time picker does not display header in local user language
issues.body:
<!--
Please report only issues corresponding to the calendar for ownCloud 9 or later.
The old calendar, which is compatible with ownCloud 8.2 or earlier, is discontinued!

Migration and CalDAV issues belong in the core repo!
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues
-->
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set OC9 language for a user to a language different than English (e.g. German or Dutch)
2. Login with the user account and select the Calendar app.
3. Create a new calendar entry and select the from and to time.
### Expected behaviour

Time picker should display the header in the local language (i.e. for German 'Stunde' and 'Minute' instead of 'Hour' and 'Minute')
### Actual behaviour

Time picker does display header in English (tested for German and Dutch)
### Server configuration

Operating system: Raspbian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)
Web server: Apache
Database: MySql
PHP version: 5.5.44
ownCloud version: (see ownCloud admin page) 9.0.0
Calendar 1.0

### Client configuration

Operating system: Windows 7

issues.title: Enhancement: Add month and year drop down for date picker
issues.body:
**Expected behaviour**
Date picker should include a drop down to easily select a different month and year for new calendar entries.
This could be done similar to how it was included in the contacts app (for selecting birthdays) in Owncloud v.8.2 (see screenshot).

The date picker should ideally also be used so on the left top you can easily navigate to a different month/year.

**Actual behaviour**
Selecting a different Month/year requires to click left/right. For calendar entries that vary from the current date more than just a few months this gets cumbersome.

**Server configuration**
Operating system: Raspbian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)
Web server: Apache
Database: MySql
PHP version: 5.5.44
ownCloud version: (see ownCloud admin page) 9.0.0
Calendar 1.0

**Updated from an older ownCloud or fresh install:** Fresh install
**Client configuration**

issues.title: Integrate Federated Sharing into the Calendar App
issues.body:
Since ownCloud 8.1 we have the concept of federated sharing for files. You can share a file with any user on any server by sharing it with `<user>@<ownCloudServer>`. We can even auto-complete this user IDs from the contacts app and from system wide address books synced between ownClouds.

I wonder if this wouldn't be a nice feature for the calendar app? Imagine if I could share a calender with any user at any ownCloud with the same federated cloud ID I also use to share files.

I'm not a CalDAV expert but this is how I think it could work:
- A ownCloud specific API would be used to send a shared calendar to a remote ownCloud server
- The remote server would basically receive a CalDAV URL and a auth token
- The remote server would then integrate the external CalDAV calendar by standard CalDAV techniques.

Opinions?

issues.title: Make event to "all day" by drag and drop
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. join the week view
2. drag a event with start-end time into the upper cell of the day (to the all day events)
3. reload the page
### Expected behaviour

The event should be marked as all day event.
### Actual behaviour

The event still has a start-end time without the "all day event" option.
### Server configuration

**Operating system**: Archlinux

**ownCloud version:** 9.0.0

**Calendar version:** checkout c09293c6752deccd2f7070f37e1922b9

**Updated from an older ownCloud or fresh install:** fresh install

### Logs

issues.title: Richer Calendar colors options
issues.body:
The owncloud calendar app currently offers 33 colors to assign to calendars. I have linked Thunderbird's lightning calendar addon via CalDav with owncloud and I'm able to choose any color from the RGB spectrum for calendars in Thunderbird, while my choice is limited to 33 colors in owncloud. 

This might not be something major, but sometimes it's useful to have a specific color code for a calendar (I separate my calendars by organizations for example).

Does this make sense?

issues.title: List view
issues.body:
I am not able to find a simple list view for the calendar in ownCloud - is there any?

A simple list view of all events would be a great enhancement for many people using the calendar app as a time planer tool. Paired with an optional simple Export of the times + appointment names (no must have!) to a text based file format like CSV would make a time management tool out of the ownCloud calendar.

Sorry for posting this as an Issue rather than post it to the feature request list, which I was not able to find.

issue_comments.body:
Yes, the CSV Export is definately not a must have. In my case it would enable me to sum up durations of events/appointments i had during a month, but this is certainly a special case.

Thanks a lot for considering the list view feature as a possibly enhancement for the calendar. Regarding the content of a list view it would be usefull to have fields in a row like:
- fromtime
- duration (in hours)
- event-title
- event-description (just as a button to be able to copy the whole text)

> I'm generally not very happy about storing the webcal data on the server.

Well, I thought of the number of requests it might make for the distant server (especially if https://github.com/owncloud/calendar/issues/599 is active). Also, it's faster. But you can have just a proxy and serve directly the downloaded file.

> Additionally getAppFolder is on a per-app basis, not per-app and per-user.
> The current way a user could access all webcal files stored on the server.

Yup, will change.
Makes more or less the same than `this.create`, just 2 little differences.

>  It allows users to download any file (whatever size it has) and pollute the server's storage.

In order to fix that I can do a first HEAD request to get the file size and check it, then check it after it has been downloaded too. If the file is really too big (fake headers) then the handling will probably timeout anyhow.

> If we really want to cache it on the server, this should be done in the dav app

The CalDAV specification says subscriptions are only a list of remote urls, there's no handling of the files, therefore it would be only for this app.

issue_comments.body:
Currently there seems to be more activity in the calendar-rework (branch). I hope this will lead to a working new calendar app soon, as this is in the work for a long time already. Anyway, maybe it is a good idea to take a little bit more time to focus on implementing a unified Web/Cal/CardDAV endpoint in core and use this in the calendar rework here, see https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5939. As far as I know this is a (fartime) goal in core already, with first steps to be found in the private repository of @DeepDiver1975: https://github.com/DeepDiver1975/dav. As it looks like CalDAV still has to be implemented here, this might be the chance to do it right at the first place, instead of doing the same work twice and changing the underlying CalDAV implementation later on.

Any opinions on how the calendar-rework should be handled? @georgehrke @jancborchardt @raghunayyar @DeepDiver1975 @karlitschek

@georgehrke There seems to be an ETA now which says OC9: https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/20371 As this app will hopefully make it into OC9 too, is it planned to use the CalDAV endpoint in core?
@DeepDiver1975 ?
I would also vote for the first approach and toggling between different sections similar as it is done with the right sidebar in the files app. However, a mockup would be nice :smiley:

Showing the edit buttons on hover makes it impossible to use on a touch device as there is no hover function. You could probably just make the options editable after clicking/tapping on them. Have a look at the tasks app, you simply click the title and the input field is shown.

Otherwise I think this is the right direction to proceed.

issue_comments.body: Done, also slightly improved the CSS quality.
@georgehrke please include the names of the maintainers in the README.md, it's easier for people to reach out that way.
Works fine :+1:
Some love here @DeepDiver1975 :)
Works for me, I also see this as faster than it was previously. :+1: x 2.
@georgehrke as discussed, WIP.

We can get definitely get rid of fontawesome if get some awesome icons from @jancborchardt. I can supply the list of icons needed, they can be a part of core.

I dont think we need mocks in production, we need it in development. jquery-timepicker is used in the events editor when the all day mode is turned off. We can think of getting rid of that as use the angular date-picker itself.
I think this can be merged now @georgehrke

Travis is giving me : Warning: Cannot find module 'jasmine-core' Use --force to continue.

I don't think this PR has anything to do with the missing deps, I am getting this in. We can get the deps figured out in another PR.
Done, @georgehrke, now your turn ;)
@codeling is this is WIP or a complete PR?
Lets go, lets go!

Lol, awesome! :D 
Just as a precaution I will hit the merge button as soon as there are no pending tests.
The colour picker is fixed afaik, can we close this?

MAMP, php log : 
`24-Oct-2015 18:02:17 UTC] PHP Fatal error:  Cannot use OCP\AppFramework\Db\Entity as Entity because the name is already in use in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/ownCloud/core/apps/calendar/db/timezonemapper.php on line 26
[24-Oct-2015 18:05:03 UTC] PHP Fatal error:  Cannot use OCP\AppFramework\Db\Entity as Entity because the name is already in use in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/ownCloud/core/apps/calendar/db/timezonemapper.php on line 26
`
@BernhardPosselt I have given you credit on the angular directive here, though. Its the only part of appframework.js we are using.
Updated as per @BernhardPosselt's call. This is awesome. @georgehrke please check and :+1:
I think we should use font-awesome till the time we have the editor our way, I will remove it when we start pushing it to a popover.

I just want to tell who cares that I have write a simple python code to do an import from ics to caldav including owncloud. absolutely it is not merge-able with your php codes but it may help someone need it.

Fullcalendar 2.5.0 will probably be released soon (it is already beta2, see https://github.com/fullcalendar/fullcalendar/releases).
Maybe it is worth, directly upgrading to this release.

I'd also vote to have a search function with OwnCloud 9.0.

But nevertheless, I really appreciate your effort @georgehrke and @raghunayyar! It's great to see so much progress on the new calendar app.
In my opinion, the calendar search should search for events.

It is probably overkill to ship all that colors to every user. But there are some individuals demanding for that much colors. In my personal opinion the colors shown in the image above (and therefore only the not uncommented ones) should be enough for nearly all use cases. The others were intended to allow the power users to easily extend the number of colors while maintaining a well founded selection of the colors based on color science.

From a design standpoint even the colors in the image above are too much. A better solution would be to integrate a color definition tool. In the current calendar app there was a 3rd party app to fulfill that task (but not integrated). I was close to start some experiments to get it running when I noticed that the development moved to calender-rework.
At the end I could imagine to have a very low amount of default colors (e.g. one row) and a color definition button to select a completely user defined color. Maybe only the color definition button is enough. But I have to see it to ground an opinion.

Sorry, I did not know that with node and npm. I will take a look into that.
But it could take some while, as I do not have much spare time...

I would suggest this color picker: http://labs.abeautifulsite.net/jquery-minicolors/without-bootstrap.html
**It is already included in the current calendar app as 3rd party code**, but not used. As far as I understand the git history, it was also included in owncloud/core some time ago.
- with bout 2-5 unique colors per user => 12 is the minimum for a family installation
- with 3 primary colors, 3 secondary colors and 6 in between you get exactly 12 evenly distributed colors from the color wheel 
- black/white text decision based on luminance is already in the current calendar code

As you search for a developer doing that integration, some words about me: I have a good understanding of html and css. Therefore I did the code changes like they are in this pull request: based on simple css changes. Regarding JavaScript and PHP, I have no experience coding with it (but dozens others like C++ or VHDL). Therefore I assume that I'm not suited to do that task. At least you would get more trouble than solution in that case. Also my spare time is extremely limited, therefore I would not be able to follow your fast development cycle. Sorry, but probably I will not of big help here.

In the future I will continue to write bug reports and create tiny pull requests (that get closed short after; but may start a fruitful discussion...)

Just for the records: I changed the code in my branch to address the issues mentioned here. So in case you could not find someone implementing a nice color picker until release 9.0, you may consider to put this reduced color set as a temporary solution. (Or use any other combination of the defined color rows):

It's explicitly forbidden by the specification to change the calendar type after creation. What happens for instance if you remove `VTODO` from `supported-calendar-component-set` that already has `VTODOs` in it.
See here: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4791#section-5.2.3

I inverted `CONFIRMED` and `TENTATIVE` in the last version.
The `!important` rule overrides the `:hover` selector below, so the icon opacity won't turn to 1 when the mouse hovers over it.

I would have preferred to directly update the objects `$scope.properties.dtstart/dtend.value` using their [set](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/get-set/set/) method rather creating new ones, but this wouldn't work. I don't understand why ...
Call to `$scope.toggledAllDay()` is useful to ensure that the default time interval (1 hour) is defined in just one place.
